text.tspan: Rough overview of I3C IP block structure
TileLink interface, registers, interrupts and alerts.
The intention is to operate almost all of the design synchronously on a
fixed-frequency 50MHz clock, including the TL-UL interface, message buffer,
all of the Controller-side logic, and as much of the Target-side logic as possible.
The I3C-side logic and conversion between driver signals and data words shall
be driven by the Controller-supplied clock (SCL) received over the I3C bus,
in order to guarantee the response time, keep the IP clock frequency low, and
reduced power consumption in Deep Sleep.
The 50MHz frequency choice lends itself naturally to Double Data Rate (HDR-DDR)
operation at the 12.5MHz frequency of the I3C bus, and if there is no 50MHz clock
available within the chip - e.g. if the other peripherals require a different frequency -
then it may be necessary to have a dedicated clock and implement CDC within
Implementation of the HCI is expected to be PIO-only and not, at this stage, include
